definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
to support/frame/rack/framework/classifier for planes, large vehicles, radios etc

sentences.english: Had Jesus not died on the cross, Christianity would not have triumphed.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌要是不死在十字架上，基督教就無法取得勝利。

sentences.english: For though he was crucified through weakness, yet he liveth by the power of God.
sentences.chinese: 他因軟弱被釘在十字架上，卻因神的大能，仍然活着。

sentences.english: So point one, that’s what the Cross frees us from.
sentences.chinese: 因此，第一點就是“十字架將我們從何境地解放出來。

sentences.english: It shall be as white as snow By Your blood and bitter passion.
sentences.chinese: 卻被你十字架所流寶血潔淨，潔白如雪。

sentences.english: Save thyself, and come down from the cross.
sentences.chinese: 可以救自己從十字架上下來吧。

sentences.english: Everyday her religious schizophrenia grew, and presently she began wearing a crucifix.
sentences.chinese: 每天她的雙重信仰都在加深，現在她開是戴十字架了。

sentences.english: Jesus bought our forgiveness when he died on the cross.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌在十字架上死亡之時買下了我們的寬恕。

sentences.english: These crosses are longer on the vertical axis than they are on the horizontal axis.
sentences.chinese: 這些都是長在十字架縱軸比他們的水平軸。

sentences.english: She saw a crucifix in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 她看見一座十字架佇立在花園中央。

sentences.english: It is a cowardly pride which would choose a downy pillow and a silken couch for a soldier of the cross.
sentences.chinese: 膽怯的驕傲爲十字架的兵士選擇羽毛枕頭和絲緞臥榻。

sentences.english: When you look at the Cross, what do you see?
sentences.chinese: 當你望向十字架時，你看到了什麼呢？

sentences.english: And that is why the Jews were scandalized by the cross.
sentences.chinese: 這就是爲什麼猶太人對十字架反感。

sentences.english: The cross at the top symbolizes Christ.
sentences.chinese: 屋頂上的十字架象徵着耶穌。

sentences.english: He makes two paintings of his mother that employ the crucifix .
sentences.chinese: 他讓兩個畫他的母親說，採用了十字架。

sentences.english: As she spoke, she fingered the large crucifix round her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她一邊把十字架戴在脖子上，一邊說着話。

definition: Holy Father/God the Father (in the Christian Trinity)
God (in Catholicism)/abbr. for 天主教[Tian1 zhu3 jiao4], Catholicism
to nail securely/to execute by means of impalement/to crucify
(third person pronoun for a divine being)
